Job Title: Medicare Stars Rating Business Analytics Advisor- Hybrid- TN, TX, PA, CT, MO- Cigna Healthcare
Job Description:
Job Summary:

We’re looking for a passionate Business Analytics Advisor with a deep knowledge of the Medicare Star Ratings program. We’re a Stars Analytics and Reporting team that loves to learn and push ourselves to provide meaningful insights to the business. If you’re a team player, aren’t afraid to be in front of business leaders, and have a solid core of technical skills, this is the role for you.

Data Management and Reporting Lead Analyst Job Responsibilities:

Process and maintain Cigna’s primary Medicare HEDIS Stars Reporting
Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports for Stars operations
Develop reports using self-service technologies like SQL Server Reporting Services
Report to stakeholders about changes to Stars measure methodologies and data trends
Support the management of Stars data architecture, partnering closely with matrix partners such as IT.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize efficiency and quality
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Support the development and management of version control workflows and processes, leveraging tools such as GitHub.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Act as a mentor and escalation point for other team analysts on problem solving and providing feedback and guidance on best practices.

Minimum Requirements:

Bachelors Degree or higher in Data Management, Information Systems highly preferred or equivalent amount of work experience
5 years or more work experience as a Data Analyst in Medicare Stars, specifically in operations and reporting
Work experience with process improvement
Deep understanding of coding version control best practices, GitHub workflows, and their application to analytics teams
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Knowledge of statistics and experience using data science languages (SAS, R, or Python)
5 years or more experience in database language including SQL Server and Teradata
5 years or more experience in data visualization in Tableau or Power BI
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Report writing experience in SQL server reporting services (SSRS)



If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Cigna Healthcare, a division of The Cigna Group, is an advocate for better health through every stage of life. We guide our customers through the health care system, empowering them with the information and insight they need to make the best choices for improving their health and vitality. Join us in driving growth and improving lives.

Major Duties and Responsibilities:

The Treasury Director is responsible for and manages the day-to-day activities of the organization’s cash management function that includes reporting and processing banking transactions; funding and cash flow forecasting; managing the Company’s investment portfolio; fostering banking relationships; and maintaining compliance with control objectives as related to cash and banking activities.

Take ownership and oversee a broad range of Treasury projects which may include liquidity management, cash flow forecasting, client specific banking solutions, post- merger integration and organizational design
Prepares reports related to the cash management function and other special purpose reports as requested or apparent. This includes but is not limited to tracking, analyzing, reporting, and forecasting daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly cash position through the creation of reports that detail cash and investment balances. Provides reports to senior accounting and finance leadership for review and in support of strategic cash decisions
Coordinates and manages the opening, closing and maintenance of inventory for all corporate bank accounts and approved signatories. This includes management, tracking and record keeping for the organization’s financial transactions including the endorsement of corporate checks, notes, documents, and transfer of funds (incoming, outgoing and between accounts)
Collaborates and coordinates with other respective departments to obtain cash flow projections. Develops charts and analysis indicating trends by day, week, month and quarter in various categories of cash usage
Provide structure analysis and recommendation in support of the Company’s internal activities and cash investments strategy
Acts as a key liaison with banks as related to the cash management and treasury functions. This includes establishing and maintaining banking relationships as well as monitoring and managing bank fees. Initiates contacts with banks when necessary to discuss related issues or challenges
Manage Debt Covenants, compliance, and on-going debt initiatives
Develop, implement, and maintain bank account structures and controls
Oversee global liquidity management, including cash positioning and forecasting



This position will report to our corporate office in Downtown Austin, Texas


Qualifications and Requirements: The requirements listed below represent the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required to perform the duties. Reasonable accommodation will be made when appropriate.

Bachelor' s Degree in Accounting
CTP Required, CPA preferred
7+ years related professional accounting and finance experience
Excellent verbal and written communication and strong presentation skills
Strong analytical and organizational skills
Excellent technical knowledge of cash management processes is essential. Good business acumen and knowledge of GAAP (specifically as it applies to cash management), budgeting, accounting, finance and investment principles is required
Incumbents should possess a high level of quantitative analysis and strategic business analysis skills and be able to make effective judgments and decisions on relative information
Good leadership, relationship management with a wide variety of partners, collaboration, and interpersonal skills are required to perform the functions as described. A demonstrated ability to build strong relationships across functional areas is essential
Incumbents need a strong detail orientation as well as good time management, decision-making and organization skills. Very good written and verbal communication and presentation skills are critical, including the ability to effectively communicate related issues to senior management
